word_mean: 背的，背侧的：指位置比其他参照物更接近背面的。在人体解剖学上与后部(posterior)同

sentence.Network_en: His dorsal fin was down and his huge pectorals were spread wide.
sentence.Network_cn: 它的脊鳍朝下耷拉着,巨大的胸鳍大张着.

sentence.Network_en: There are usually no dorsal pores in the first few intersegmental grooves.
sentence.Network_cn: 身体前几个节间沟内经常无背孔.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from late Latin dorsalis, from Latin dorsum 'back'

entry.tran: (鱼或动物的)背部的，背上的，背侧的
entry.def: Dorsal means relating to the back of a fish or animal.

means.word_mean: 1. belonging to or on or near the back or upper surface of an animal or organ or part;

sentences.sentence: "the dorsal fin is the vertical fin on the back of a fish and certain marine mammals"

means.word_mean: 2. facing away from the axis of an organ or organism;

sentences.sentence: "the abaxial surface of a leaf is the underside or side facing away from the stem"

auth_sentence.content: A dorsal ridge of slate-coloured rock.

auth_sentence.content: The dorsal plumes of the Egrets.

auth_sentence.content: The whales are jet-black in color and have no shark-like dorsal fin.
